Dwarven Pantheon [LG]

The dwarven gods are one large family, with @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Torag]{Torag} as its patriarch. He is joined by his brothers @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Magrim]{Magrim} (the Taskmaster) and @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Angradd]{Angradd} (the Forge Fire), his half-sister @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Dranngvit]{Dranngvit} (the Debt Minder), and his wife @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Folgrit]{Folgrit} (the Watchful Mother). His children are @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Bolka]{Bolka} (the Golden Gift), @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Grundinnar]{Grundinnar} (the Peacemaker), @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Kols]{Kols} (the Oath-Keeper), and @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Trudd]{Trudd} (the Mighty). Torag's evil former student @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Droskar]{Droskar} (the Dark Smith), though technically part of the dwarven pantheon, is rarely invoked by any save duergars.

Edicts develop skills useful to your community (especially crafting, mining, and trading), honor your ancestors through traditions and rituals

Anathema dishonor your family, willingly break a contract or oath, irreparably damage an ancestral relic

Areas of Concern ancestry, crafting, dwarves, relationships

Follower Alignments LG, NG, LN, N

Pantheon Members @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Angradd]{Angradd}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Bolka]{Bolka}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Dranngvit]{Dranngvit}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Folgrit]{Folgrit}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Grundinnar]{Grundinnar}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Kols]{Kols}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Magrim]{Magrim}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Torag]{Torag}, @Compendium[pf2e.deities.Trudd]{Trudd}

Devotee Benefits

Divine Ability Constitution or Wisdom
Divine Font heal
Divine Skill Diplomacy
Favored Weapon warhammer
Domains creation, family, protection, wealth
Alternate Domains duty, glyph
Cleric Spells 1st: ant haul, 4th: creation, 7th: retrocognition
name: Dwarven Pantheon
